awd_titl_txt: Dissertation Research:  Narratives and Practices of Everyday Life Among Taos Lifestyle Migrants
awd_abstract_narration: 9318958  Rodriguez  This project involves the dissertation research of a student in  cultural anthropology from the University of New Mexico.  The  student will conduct ethnographic research on middle-class White  "lifestyle migrants" living in Taos, NM, an Indian town.  The  research will see how these people define their lives in contrast  and distinction to the dominant more commercially-oriented  society.  Using techniques of participant observation, survey  interviews with individuals and with local institutions, the  student will analyze this counter-current in contemporary US  society.   This research is important because it adds to the scientifically  trained capacity of the nation, and will provide a case study of  an alternative life-style.  Understanding how this sector of  society defines itself will provide a valuable comparative case  to enrich our understanding of contemporary life in the US.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
